data.title: Medal of Alexandra of Denmark, Princess of Wales
data.text:
Object details

Object number

M33w1

Creator(s)

Feodora Gleichen (London, 1861 - 1922, London) - medalist

Alexandra, Queen Consort Of Great Britain (Copenhagen, 1844 - 1925, Sandringham) - subject

Title

Medal of Alexandra of Denmark, Princess of Wales

Date

1888

Medium

Bronze

Provenance

Possibly cast as a commemorative medal of the 1888 silver jubilee of Princess Alexandra's marriage to the Prince of Wales.

Purchased by Isabella Stewart Gardner from Feodora Gleichen through the novelist and poet Charles Hamilton Aidé (1826–1906) for £2 on 7 July 1894.

Signatures, inscriptions, and markings

Inscribed (obverse): ALEXANDRA WALLIAE PRINCIPISSA

Signed (obverse, under the shoulder): FG

Dimensions

7.9 cm (3 1/8 in.)

Commentary

Isabella Stewart Gardner kept meticulous records of many of her acquisitions. In keeping with this legacy, object information is continually being reviewed, updated, and enriched in order to give greater access to the collection.

Gallery

Vatichino

Bibliography

Philip Attwood. "The Slade Girls." 'The British Numismatic Journal 56 (1986), p. 157, 173, no. 60.

Rights and reproductions
